Personal Color and Fill Scale

Source: R/scale_personal.R
scale-personal.Rd

These color and fill functions are useful for generating my personal color scheme for ggplot2 plots.

scale_color_personal(
  palette = "main",
  discrete = TRUE,
  reverse = FALSE,
  na.value = "grey80",
  ...
)

scale_fill_personal(
  palette = "main",
  discrete = TRUE,
  reverse = FALSE,
  na.value = "grey80",
  ...
)

Arguments

palette

String, the color palette to use (defaults to main). There are several options available: main, playful, heat (for heat meaps), heat_mono (for monochromatic heatmaps), full, decent, bright.
discrete

Logical, defaults to TRUE. Set to FALSE when using a continuous scale.
reverse

Logical, defaults to FALSE. Setting this to TRUE changes the order of the colors.
na.value

String, the color for NA values.
...

Additional arguments passed to ggplot2::discrete_scale() for discrete scales and ggplot2::scale_color_gradientn() for continuous scales.

Details

With these functions one can create custom color and fill scales according to my personal color scheme. Implemented are also various variations of the maine color palette. All scales can be used for discrete scales (default) or continuous scales (with discrete = FALSE). All scales can be reversed, if necessary, by setting the argumet reverse = TRUE.

Examples

library(ggplot2)

# Change default color scale
ggplot(palmer_penguins, aes(bill_length_mm, bill_depth_mm, color = species)) +
  geom_point() +
  scale_color_personal()


# Change default fill scale
ggplot(palmer_penguins, aes(species, bill_length_mm, fill = species)) +
  geom_boxplot() +
  scale_fill_personal()
